content: I think I'll stick with the "To be or not to be" soliloquy, but I'll definitely keep your suggestions in mind to make it more relevant to the audition. I'll focus on bringing a fresh interpretation to the role and showcasing my acting skills. And who knows, maybe I can even find some irony or humor in the soliloquy to make it more fitting for "A Midsummer Night's Dream". Thanks for the advice! By the way, speaking of "The Sound of Music", did I tell you that it opened on a Friday evening exactly three weeks ago? I was in the chorus, and it was such a thrill!
